<div class="custom_html tourIB1">
<div class="proGall"><img decoding="async" src="/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/gangotri-temple.jpg" alt="Gangotri Yatra from Delhi" title="Gangotri Yatra from Delhi" width="750" height="450" loading="lazy"></div>

<div class="custom_html tourIB2">
<div class="tour-overview">
<div class="toBt"><i class="fa fa-file"></i> Tour Overview</div>
<p>Located in the Uttarkashi district of Uttarakhand, Gangotri is dedicated to River Ganga and is one of the most important and significant holy sites in the Char Dham circuit. Likewise, other religious sites, Gangotri also hold myriads of legends related to its origin. There is interesting mythology stating that to wash away the sins of King Bhagirath and his forefathers, Goddess Ganga transformed herself into a river and started flowing with immense speed. To stop the devastating speed of the river, Lord Shiva gathered Ganga into his matted hair and controlled the irresistible flow of the water stream. Gaumukh (set in huge Gangotri glacier) is believed to be the originating place of River Ganga and so the glacier also holds importance in Hinduism.</p>
<p>Likewise other pilgrimages of the Char Dham circuit, Gangotri is also an annual pilgrimage and is opened for half a year i.e. with the onset of the summer season and gets closed before the winter commences as the region receives a heavy snowfall hence the shrine become inaccessible. Gangotri also serves the base of several trekking trails viz. Bhojwasa, Gangotri Glacier, Tapovan, Shivling Peak, and Gaumukh. There are oodles of sightseeing destinations adorning the region Pandava Cave, Bhairon Ghati, Gaumukh Glacier, Tapovan, and the submerged Shivalinga. Gushing sound of gorgeously flowing Bhagirathi River, scenic vistas of steep and lofty terrains, and snow-clad mountain peaks allure tourists from all across the globe who come to experience not only spirituality but also serene and tranquil ambiance.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="custom_html tourIB4">
<div class="tour-collection">
<h2 class="tourDBox"><i class="fa fa-bus" aria-hidden="true"></i> Gangotri Yatra Itinerary from Delhi</h2>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details" id="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 1 :</span>Delhi – Haridwar</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="">
<p>Welcome to Delhi, the capital city of India! After a firm welcome at the airport, our representative will accompany you in driving towards Haridwar where upon arrival you need to check-in at the pre-booked hotel. After a few hours of relaxation, move out of the hotel for a local sightseeing tour in Haridwar and reach Har-Ki-Pauri Ghat at least 45 minutes before the evening Ganga Aarti.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 2 :</span>Haridwar – Uttarkashi</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Post breakfast, leave the hotel and drive towards Uttarkashi. After the completion of the formalities asked for check-in, loosen yourself in the comfy hotel room and then proceed towards Vishwanath Temple, Bhairav Temple, etc. Your overnight halt arrangement is done at Uttarkashi so head back to the hotel.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 3 :</span>Gangotri Darshan</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Post a relishing morning meal, drive towards the holy shrine of Gangotri en-route which you will be exploring the panoramic landscapes of Harsil Village, the picturesque views of the Himalayas, and the gorgeously flowing Bhagirathi River. Post Darshan and then drive back to the hotel in Uttarkashi.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 4 :</span>Uttarkashi – Rishikesh</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Post you binge on the first meal of the day, drive towards Rishikesh where you will be spending your overnight. Next, in the morning drive towards the Parmarth Niketan Ashram where you can participate in the evening Ganga Aarti.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 5 :</span>Rishikesh – Delhi</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>After you complete your breakfast, go for the sightseeing tour in Rishikesh and to explore the star attractions of Triveni Ghat, Lakshman Jhula, Ram Jhula, Bharat Mandir, etc. Our representative bids adieu after dropping you at the airport or the railway station.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="custom_html tourIB8">
<div id="popularBox8" class="tour-collection">
<h3><i class="fa fa-question-circle" aria-hidden="true"></i> FAQs for Gangotri Yatra from Delhi</h3>
<div class="panel-body">
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> Can We Visit Gangotri Without Registering?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> Char Dham registration is required for those planning to visit the temples of Badrinath, Kedarnath, Gangotri, Yamunotri, or Hemkund Sahib in Uttarakhand. The facility for obtaining a biometric registration document is very simple.</p>
</p></div></div></div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> Is It Necessary To Trek To Gangotri?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> Gangotri is a difficult trek in the Himalayas that runs from Gangotri to Gaumukh. In the Himalayan region, you can choose from a variety of trails. The 17-kilometer trek to the Hindu holy land is located on the banks of the Bhagirathi and is filled with extraordinary adventures that make for a truly unforgettable experience.</p>
</p></div></div></div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> Which Month Is Best For Visiting Gangotri?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> Gangotri experiences its summer season beginning in April and ending in May. The summer season in this location is generally pleasant, as the temperature never exceeds 30° Celsius even in the summer. However, most nights are bitterly cold.</p>
</p></div></div></div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> Which Peak Can Be Seen From Gangotri?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> The Chaukhamba peak is 7,138 meters high. The Gangotri glacier is located on the western slope of this four-pillar massif, which is the highest peak in the Gangotri range. Its spectacular view can be seen on the Deorital-Chopta- Chandrashila Trek, which spans Uttarkashi-Chamoli and Rudraprayag districts.</p>
</p></div></div></div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> What Is The Distance Between Delhi And Gangotri?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> The distance between Delhi and Gangotri is 501 kilometers, with driving directions and a route map.</p>
</p></div></div></div></div></div>
</div>
</div>
